<a id="CameraServer"></a>

# CameraServer

**Inherits:** [Object](Object.md)

Server keeping track of different cameras accessible in Redot.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

The **CameraServer** keeps track of different cameras accessible in Redot. These are external cameras such as webcams or the cameras on your phone.

It is notably used to provide AR modules with a video feed from the camera.

\ **Note:** This class is currently only implemented on Linux, Android, macOS, and iOS. On other platforms no [CameraFeed](CameraFeed.md)\\ s will be available. To get a [CameraFeed](CameraFeed.md) on iOS, the camera plugin from [godot-ios-plugins](https://github.com/godotengine/godot-ios-plugins) is required.

## Property Descriptions

<a id="CameraServer_property_monitoring_feeds"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **monitoring_feeds** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#CameraServer_property_monitoring_feeds)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_monitoring_feeds**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_monitoring_feeds**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the server is actively monitoring available camera feeds.

This has a performance cost, so only set it to ``true`` when you're actively accessing the camera.

\ **Note:** After setting it to ``true``, you can receive updated camera feeds through the [camera_feeds_updated](CameraServer.md#CameraServer_signal_camera_feeds_updated) signal.




```gdscript
    func _ready():
        CameraServer.camera_feeds_updated.connect(_on_camera_feeds_updated)
        CameraServer.monitoring_feeds = true

    func _on_camera_feeds_updated():
        var feeds = CameraServer.feeds()
```


```csharp
    public override void _Ready()
    {
        CameraServer.CameraFeedsUpdated += OnCameraFeedsUpdated;
        CameraServer.MonitoringFeeds = true;
    }

    void OnCameraFeedsUpdated()
    {
        var feeds = CameraServer.Feeds();
    }
```
